body:
### Description

Current spec:
- nvim v0.11.3
- lazyvim
- mason
- nvim-lspconfig latest (from master)
- clangd extra

# Problem

I have a git C++ project in `~/proj/test`, and when the active buffer is on a C++ file, nvim actions such as Telescope fzf, ripgrep, `:TERM` now all start from the home dir `~`, which make all searching slow and tedious.

# What I found

The root dir implementation on https://www.lazyvim.org/extras/lang/clangd (this one proved my point better than the current code at https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/blob/master/lsp/clangd.lua:

```lua
root_dir = function(fname)
        return require("lspconfig.util").root_pattern(
          "Makefile",
          "configure.ac",
          "configure.in",
          "config.h.in",
          "meson.build",
          "meson_options.txt",
          "build.ninja"
        )(fname) or require("lspconfig.util").root_pattern("compile_commands.json", "compile_flags.txt")(
          fname
        ) or require("lspconfig.util").find_git_ancestor(fname)
      end,
```

and I suspect this matches my home dir where I have a `Makefile` present (for some scripting, irrelevant).

`:LspInfo` shows:
```
...
vim.lsp: Active Clients ~
- clangd (id: 1)
  - Version: clangd version 20.1.8 (https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project 87f0227cb60147a26a1eeb4fb06e3b505e9c7261) linux+grpc x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
  - Root directory: ~
...
```

After changing the `~/Makefile` to something else and restart nvim, the above actions work normally, `:LspInfo`:

```
vim.lsp: Active Clients ~
- clangd (id: 1)
  - Version: clangd version 20.1.8 (https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project 87f0227cb60147a26a1eeb4fb06e3b505e9c7261) linux+grpc x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
  - Root directory: ~/proj/test
...
```

# Workaround

At the moment, I modified my own config to have the root_dir as the folder nvim is opened in. Quick n dirty.

Many, if not most people would not have this problem. But I think it is worth to consider a fix.

better in what way? be specific, what is the concrete difference between the two? they both have ".git" as an option.

also `Makefile` is not mentioned in https://github.com/neovim/nvim-lspconfig/blob/master/lsp/clangd.lua , so I don't understand how that's related?

if your home dir looks like a workspace it will be detected as a workspace. I don't know what in the world you expect. Maybe home dir should always be rejected by `vim.lsp.config` ?

title: "clangd" default config has current working directory point to home dir when there exists a `~/Makefile`
